definition: inch (unit of length equal to 2.54 cm.)
United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]

sentences.english: I do my e-mail on a 20-inch liquid crystal display (LCD) monitor.
sentences.chinese: 現在我在20英寸的液晶顯示器上發電子郵件。

sentences.english: Twelve inches go to one foot.
Is 0.76 inch really thin and compared to what?
sentences.chinese: 76英寸真的很薄嗎，和什麼相比呢？

sentences.english: If no returns, one-inch the hole.
sentences.chinese: 如果返高不夠，開1英寸的小孔。

sentences.english: Both made of pine; both one inch thick.
sentences.chinese: 都是由松木做成的，都是一英寸厚。

sentences.english: The fish just moved away slowly and the old man could not raise him an inch.
sentences.chinese: 那魚只顧慢慢地遊開去，老人無法把它往上拉一英寸。

sentences.english: The average height (at the shoulder) of a gray wolf is 26 to 32 inches.
sentences.chinese: 它們的平均高度都在26到32英寸之間。

sentences.english: Take a woman with a 27-inch waist.
sentences.chinese: 以一位腰圍27英寸的女士爲例。

sentences.english: The downside is that you’ll lose at least a few additional inches of ceiling height.
sentences.chinese: 缺點是你可能會額外的失去幾英寸的頭頂空間淨高。

sentences.english: Amount of day precipitations in in, cm or mm.
sentences.chinese: 每天以英寸，釐米，毫米的降雨量。

sentences.english: Doing so can earn you as much as two inches of extra legroom.
sentences.chinese: 這樣就可以爲你提供至少兩英寸的額外空間。

sentences.english: The new battleship will be armed with 16-inch guns.
sentences.chinese: 那艘戰艦將裝備16英寸口徑的大炮。

sentences.english: Fill a large high-sided skillet with 1 inch water.
sentences.chinese: 取一個較深的煮鍋，倒入1英寸深的水。

sentences.english: This hole is under an inch from the aluminum base.
sentences.chinese: 這個洞是從下一個基地英寸的鋁。

sentences.english: Wheels of mountain bikes range from 26 to 29 inches.
sentences.chinese: 車輪的山地自行車範圍從26至29英寸。

sentences.english: He shows me the 6-inch scar on his belly.
sentences.chinese: 他還給我看了肚子上6英寸的疤。

definition: body of a vehicle or machine/fuselage of a plane
to get rid of/to put aside/to reject/to keep control/to hold (one's breath)
